channel.title: The assassins
channel.description:
A few suggestions for the assassin NPC:
1. In HL1, the assassins mostly avoided the direct contact with the player by running and jumping away. I could imagine that it would make sense, if the assassins would go into a direct confrontation sometimes and not only shooting from the distance and for example try to stab the player in close combat, especially if you stand with your back to them.
They could jump at you from a higher position for melee attacking.
I think the melee abilities (punching, kicking and the use of their dagger) of this enemy should also more show to advantage in general.
2. Also it would be cool, if the assassins could perform a few more athletic movements than in in the original. Like doing a roundoff. I could imagine, that the movie Matrix would also give you some inspiration for great fighting movements.
3. They should be able to jump onto higher objects (like a container) from the ground.

item.title: The assassins
item.dc:creator: mechaelite
item.description:
yeah, I was first heavily sad with the hydra going cut, then I knew why and instead of keep saying: **** You you have taken away my favourite monster! I said: Thanx valve, I don’t wanna get insta killed by a monster wich is impossible to kill.

Read full topic

^
True.

Read full topic

item.title: The assassins
item.dc:creator: DrasarSalman
item.description:
Ok… I am new to this thread, but this collides with hl2 beta; Because you are using the source engine for half-life 2, you may end up with a very buggy assassin! The assassin was buggy even in hl1!

Also, if you are using a backstab action, you would think this is easy scripting (L0L it really is). But you have to think of why the hydra NPC did not get in the original half life 2, even when it had some awesome AI and stuff; the player will sometimes not know who killed him/her then it will cause frustration witch will minimize the game experience!

Read full topic

item.title: The assassins
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
higgsboson:

I don’t seem to have pak1.pak, the search only found pak0.pak, but that’s in a folder for a mod called “Life’s End”, a pretty good mod, you guys should try it if you haven’t.

I have a weird version of Half-Life, although I bought the original WAN version back in the good old days, it won’t run properly in Crossover Games on my Mac, so I downloaded this “repacked” version from somewhere. It automatically installed Half-Life, but with the steam-ish interface, without steam, and it has the High-Def pack built in somehow… Oh, it also has “Half-Life: Uplink”, the demo for HL, integrated into Half-Life for some reason. Some hacker thought it was a good idea… If you have any clue about how I could fix that, I would appreciate any help…

Basically, when you go into a portal in the Lambda Core, it starts Uplink, then when you finish Uplink, you continue where you left off in HL. I really want to get rid of that part, it’s horrid, but this hacked version is the only thing I could get to install with emulation. This has got to be the strangest setup ever.

Please don’t tell me this is illegal and wrong since I payed for the original game, and I’m willing to pay again if it comes out for Steam for Mac. But for now, this is the only way I can play HL on my Mac, and it’s very practical…

That’s some mod you can download for HL. It just replaces a few maps with teh needed level change tweaks, and then add the new maps there. Wherever you got it from must have had that installed. You may be able to remove it, but I’m not sure.

Edit: I’d need to know if the models are dumped right into the folders, or actually in .pak files. I’m not really sure. You know you can just use programs like Boot Camp that let you run Windows on a Mac, right?

Read full topic

item.title: The assassins
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
That’s not so much out of the question or ‘too advanced’ in terms of what the engines are capable of, it’s not something that would be implemented because it would be god damn annoying. What if she knocked away your crowbar & you couldn’t or didn’t bother to find it after? Not to mention all the other horrible & annoying shit it could result in.

Blocking the crowbar would just be pointless.

Read full topic

item.title: The assassins
item.dc:creator: mechaelite
item.description:
Kevlar:

Nice ideas. I think that the Assasins are a great opportunity for some really spectacular AI and animations. Also, as these are assasins obviously trained in advanced martial arts, a cool new mechanic would be the ability to disarm you of your currently equipped weapon for you to take back once you kill the bitch. Of course, that’s probably too advanced and too far beyond the limits of classic HL mechanics. Maybe make it so the Assasin is able to block some strikes from your crowbar, should you manage to get close enough to get a swing at her.

maybe it’s impossible for the old half-life mechanics but maybe not for the ep2 mechanics…

Read full topic

item.title: The assassins
item.dc:creator: Kevlar
item.description:
Marc:

A few suggestions for the assassin NPC:

  1. In HL1, the assassins mostly avoided the direct contact with the player by running and jumping away.
    I could imagine that it would make sense, if the assassins would go into a direct confrontation sometimes and not only shooting from the distance and for example try to stab the player in close combat, especially if you stand with your back to them.

They could jump at you from a higher position for melee attacking.

I think the melee abilities (punching, kicking and the use of their dagger) of this enemy should also more show to advantage in general.

  1. Also it would be cool, if the assassins could perform a few more athletic movements than in in the original. Like doing a roundoff. I could imagine, that the movie Matrix would also give you some inspiration for great fighting movements.

  2. They should be able to jump onto higher objects (like a container) from the ground.

Nice ideas. I think that the Assasins are a great opportunity for some really spectacular AI and animations. Also, as these are assasins obviously trained in advanced martial arts, a cool new mechanic would be the ability to disarm you of your currently equipped weapon for you to take back once you kill the bitch. Of course, that’s probably too advanced and too far beyond the limits of classic HL mechanics. Maybe make it so the Assasin is able to block some strikes from your crowbar, should you manage to get close enough to get a swing at her.

item.title: The assassins
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
It already uses OpenGL, I think it’s mac compatible- it just needs to be made available over steam for Mac.

Read full topic

item.title: The assassins
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
No, currently we don’t really know what’s coming, they said “the Half-Life series” is coming, but no one really knows what exactly that means. For example, I’m sure HL1 will be available, however, maybe they will want to only port the HL: Source version, since it’s easier for them. However, the Source version doesn’t work with all the awesome mods for HL. I would love it if the original, non-Source HL would make it to the Mac, because of the mods (and the feeling of nostalgia).

Read full topic

item.title: The assassins
item.dc:creator: Spycrabz
item.description:
Comrade Tiki:

At any rate, my faith in the competence of the residents of Sydney has been restored, at least until the next time I hear the name Sheila and fall into old stereotyping.

Glad you’re leading the mod.

If you think that’s bad, try Canberra.

Read full topic

item.title: The assassins
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
I’m glad this man knows things about HL1 and isn’t just a source-obsessed wiener. I saw someone online describe Gordon Freeman as “the guy from Half-Life 2” and nearly lost my faith in humanity.

At any rate, my faith in the competence of the residents of Sydney has been restored, at least until the next time I hear the name Sheila and fall into old stereotyping.

Glad you’re leading the mod.

Read full topic

item.title: The assassins
item.dc:creator: Power_Dust
item.description:
You don’t need to remove everything, there is a special weblink which you have to copy into your browser, then Steam will automatically uninstall the High Definition pack.

Read full topic

item.title: The assassins
item.dc:creator: ManlyStump
item.description:
higgsboson:

By the way, is there a way to uninstall the high-def pack? I hate it anyway!

Remove everything, install just the game again

Read full topic

item.title: The assassins
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
raw_bean:

Can’t believe no-one pointed out yet that the cloaking behaviour had nothing to do with the high-def pack, but the difficulty level. Play on Hard and they cloak whenever they’re not shooting you. Play on any other difficulty level and they don’t.

I didn’t know that indeed! But I swear I’ve always played on Hard, and I only noticed the cloaking thing when I installed the High-Def Pack on another machine… But it’s possible that my first installation was slightly modified so the “hard” and “easy” mode didn’t change anything, they all did what “medium” did. Well, that’s how I remember it… By the way, is there a way to uninstall the high-def pack? I hate it anyway!

Read full topic

item.title: The assassins
item.dc:creator: ManlyStump
item.description:
jarms48a:

Ah the assassins the most annoying, powerful and comical relief of an enemy as there could have been.

Really? In a game where you have to fight a giant crustacean with a single 500 pound testicle? You consider the ASSASSINS to be the most comical?!

Ah the assassins the most annoying, powerful and comical relief of an enemy as there could have been.

Off topic: first post yes.
